message: True, my research was fairly limited. Unfortunately the information in your link appears to be behind a paywall (but I am interested in what it says).

Edge allows something vaguely like this. You can save a set of tabs for later, and then on each tab set there's a share option, which uses the Windows share contract. Share it to email and it populates a message with a list of links with page titles and thumbnails. I've found it somewhat useful, although it would be a lot better if the Edge set-aside feature existed on mobile and sync'd, and if OneNote had better share target support.

Thanks, that's useful! I realized the providers we ship CAN be localized (to match up with markets like this), but after a quick test I see that the mail providers for the German Firefox build are the same as the default. I'll have to make a bug about this!

> we are shipping with only Gmail support. That covers most people, but it feels wrong.

"most people in the US", you meant to say? At least, your source is US-only. Gmail is far less popular e.g. in Germany -- less than 20%, it seems: https://de.statista.com/sta...

Ah, it showed one site for free for me. :/
